document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of management's direction and support for information security
control.control_objective: Ensure management direction and support for information security in accordance with business requirements and relevant laws and regulations

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Information security policy and topic-specific policies should be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.
key_requirements: Communicated to relevant personnel and interested parties

change_from_iso_27001_2013.note: The new ISO 27001:2022 version explicitly calls out that a pack or suite of policies will be required rather than just the headline information security policy
change_from_iso_27001_2013.improvement: More explicit requirement for topic-specific policies

implementation_requirements.description: The Senior leadership team is responsible for developing, approving, and implementing appropriate information security policies.
The policy should address business needs, legal obligations, and security risks

policy_must_address.detail: Align with business strategies and requirements
Comply with all relevant laws, regulations, and contracts
Consider current and potential threats to information security

implementation_requirements.description: The main information security policy must include specific statements

required_policy_statements.detail: Clearly define what constitutes information security for the organisation
Establish clear information security goals or a framework for setting them
Outline principles for all information security activities
Commit to meeting all applicable information security requirements
Commit to ongoing improvement of the information security management system
Assign responsibility for information security management to specific roles
Establish procedures for handling exceptions to security policies

implementation_requirements.description: Topic-specific policies provide detailed guidance on implementing specific security controls. These must align with and support the main information security policy.
implementation_requirements.note: Topic-specific policies can be called standards, directives, or other suitable names

implementation_requirements.description: Top management must approve the main policy and any changes to it

approval_requirements.topic_specific_policies: Relevant personnel with necessary authority and expertise should develop, review, and approve

implementation_requirements.description: Regular policy reviews are essential to ensure policies remain current and effective
review_should_assess: Changes to the organisation's business strategy
Updates to laws, regulations, and contracts

implementation_requirements.description: Policies must be communicated to all relevant personnel and stakeholders in a clear, accessible, and understandable format

communication_requirements.acknowledgment: Recipients should acknowledge their understanding and agreement to comply

implementation_requirements.external_distribution_note: When distributing policies outside the organisation, care must be taken to protect confidential information

steps.action: Work out what policies you actually require
steps.detail: Identify all policies needed based on business needs, legal requirements, and security risks
Develop main information security policy and all topic-specific policies
Obtain approval from top management for main policy and appropriate authority for topic-specific policies
Make policies available in appropriate format and location
Ensure all relevant personnel acknowledge understanding and agreement to comply
Establish review schedule and process for ongoing policy review and updates

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Establish comprehensive information security policy framework with management support
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Critical - foundation of information security management system
key_principles: Suite of policies covering all relevant areas
Alignment with business needs and legal requirements
Protection of confidential information when distributing externally

related_requirements.ukgc_context: UK Gambling Commission requires compliance with ISO 27001 security standards for critical systems
other_iso_controls: ISO 27001 A 5.2 - Information security roles and responsibilities

critical_systems: Electronic systems that record, store, process, share, transmit or retrieve sensitive customer information
Electronic systems that generate, transmit, or process random numbers used to determine game outcomes
Electronic systems that store results or current state of customer's gamble
Points of entry to and exit from critical systems
Communication networks that transmit sensitive customer information
ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must demonstrate information security policies meeting ISO 27001 Annex A 5.1 requirements for all critical systems

supplementary_guidance.flexibility: Topic-specific policies can vary across organisations
supplementary_guidance.naming_convention: Organisation can choose format and names for policy documents (e.g., standards, directives)
supplementary_guidance.best_practice: Use prewritten ISO 27001 Policy Pack and follow ISO 27001 Policies Ultimate Guide for efficient implementation
